verb.description: Complain or protest about something in a bad-tempered but typically muted way.
examples: his father was grumbling that he hadn't heard a word from him
he grumbled something about the decision being unnecessary
the main grumble is that he spends too much time away

origin: Late 16th century: from obsolete grumme (probably of Germanic origin and related to Dutch grommen) + -le.
